alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 7:15PM CDT until April 15 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Prairie County in central Arkansas... Lonoke County in central Arkansas... West central Monroe County in eastern Arkansas... Southeastern Pulaski County in central Arkansas... North central Arkansas County in southeastern Arkansas... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 715 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jacksonville to near Scott to near Sweet Home to Ironton, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Jacksonville... Stuttgart... Lonoke... Hazen... De Valls Bluff... Little Rock AFB... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Fredonia... Humnoke... Keo... Ulm... Roe... Barrettsville... Dobbs Landing... Ironton... Estes... Meto... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Little Rock.
